meanings.definition: Forming an essential foundation or starting point; fundamental.
meanings.sent1: Learning basic math skills is important for understanding more advanced concepts.
meanings.sent2: She wore a basic black dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The recipe called for basic ingredients like flour and sugar.
meanings.sent4: His basic understanding of the topic helped him grasp the new information quickly.
meanings.sent5: The basic rules of the game were easy to follow.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the simplest or most fundamental level of something.
meanings.sent1: The basic design of the building was sleek and modern.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were written in basic English for easy understanding.
meanings.sent3: His basic wardrobe consisted of plain t-shirts and jeans.
meanings.sent4: The basic idea behind the project was to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The basic outline of the plan was clear from the start.

meanings.definition: Having the properties of a base, or containing a base.
meanings.sent1: The shampoo had a basic pH level to prevent damage to the hair.
meanings.sent2: The soil in the garden was basic, ideal for growing certain plants.
meanings.sent3: The basic solution turned the litmus paper blue.
meanings.sent4: Her basic knowledge of chemistry helped her in the lab.
meanings.sent5: The basic nature of the substance made it easy to work with.
